look: It's a brass key. You get the feeling that it's only useful in the tutorial. It definitely opens a locked door or two.
It's a regular old banana. It has a pleasing yellow color.
It's a belt. Like, not the kind you wear, the kind that connect pulleys together. You know, the mechanical kind of belt.

args: It's a small, smooth stone. You feel the urge to throw it for some reason.
It's a small, smooth stone. You feel the urge to throw it for some reason--but not here.
You really don't see the point of throwing the stone right now.

look: It's a cylindrical metal rod about an inch and a half in diameter. It's rusty but still sturdy. It has a grip at one end. Maybe it's a handle of some kind.
It's rusty but should still do its job well enough.
It's a gardening trowel--a little rusty but should still be fine.
The strip of red fabric is faded and tattered.
callCommon|ophelias_journal1_look|global-common
callCommon|ophelias_journal2_look|global-common
They're a pair of scissors. They're the size you would expect except they're made of clear glass.
It's a whitish color and throbs and shakes. It holds life within. Horrible, horrible life.
It's a small glass vial with a cork stopper. The liquid within shimmers.
It's a heavy duty metal flashlight. There's a button on it that toggles it on and off. You could "use flashlight" to toggle the switch back and forth.

args: You flick the switch on your flashlight, turning it off.
You flick the switch on your flashlight, turning it on.

look: It's pretty heavy but could do a lot of damage.

It is the off-white color of bone. It's a rough sphere, about a foot in diameter but it's surface isn't smooth. Instead, it's covered in multitudinous little white spikes all over. It's got an umbilical-like stem that is a bone-white color with blue veins just beneath the surface.
You don't know how you know this, but the rune represents the etavoner charm.
You don't know how you know this, but the rune represents the eltnamsid charm.
callCommon|hatch_note_look|global-common
It's a glass bottle with a cork stopper. It has red liquid inside and a label that reads "potion of healing".

use: Now's not the time. You might need it later.

look: It's an empty glass bottle with a cork stopper. It's labeled "potion of healing".
It's an glass bottle with a cork stopper filled with water. It's labeled "potion of healing".
It's an iron key.
It's a large rainbow-colored shell, probably six inches in diameter, reflecting all the colors of the rainbow. It's one of the most beautiful things you've ever seen.
It's a purplish-ish lumpy sac. It once lived inside a giant hornet but it's yours now.

use: There's no need to use it.

look: callCommon|broken_box_look|global-common
ifFlagWrite|!G.BOXACTIVATED|It's a small silver box about 4 inches square and 2 inches deep. The outside of the box is very ornamental but the inside is empty and devoid of any filligree.

ifFlagWrite|G.BOXACTIVATED|It's a small silver box about 4 inches square and 2 inches deep. The outside of the box is very ornamental but the inside is empty and devoid of any filligree. All across its surface it is covered in glowing runes.
use: To use a box, you usually open them. Try that instead.

args: You open the box. There's nothing inside so you close it again.

look: It's a piece of parchment, yellowed with age, partially rolled up at the edges. It depicts an area connected by twisting, turning passageways. Many lead to question marks but someone's drawn a line through it, showing the way.
callCommon|crumpled_note|global-common
It's a little blue from the mold but you can read it just fine:

] I'm going to the black mountain to delay "It". Rhode, continue the search. If we can find it, maybe we can stop "It". I already told you of the man that pursues me but in case "It" has eaten the memory, I will write it here.
] DO NOT TRUST THE MAN NAMED STANLEY.
callCommon|folded_note|global-common
It's a plant with white leaves and a thick, brown, two-pronged root.
callCommon|parchment_look|global-common
